ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This is an intensive French course which covers a wide variety of topics in French literature, grammar, and film. Every students French, both written and verbal, significantly improved over the course of the semester.
I bettered my reading and listening comprehension. Our work is heavily concentrated on books and films.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There was a very high workload that made me feel limited in my capabilities to take other classes that I am interested in, due to fear that I cant handle the added work.

The class facilitates learning French very well, forcing students to practice reading and writing almost every night. On the flip side, the class gives students a lot of work, approximately 1-2 hours every night.

I think at times, the material was very outdated and seemed slightly politically incorrect. I wish we addressed that more in class. The workload is pretty unbalanced, at the beginning of the semester our homework assignments would take double the amount that was given towards the end. I also wish we were given more practice for exams, at times we wouldn't always be given answer keys in time to maximize our learning.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If they are interested in learning french, then yes. I think that for a class that fulfills a distributional requirement (and therefore that I need to take and am not very interested in otherwise), the workload is not worth it. I think the professor and the teaching style in the class was excellent and I learned a lot and progressed in my abilities to speak French, but it also hindered me from being able to take a fifth class or another class with an intense workload because I was scared I couldnt handle it.
I would recommend this course to any student interested in learning French at a high level that has previous experience in French courses at Yale or in high school.
I would recommend to a student who is majoring in French.
